Package edu.lehigh.cse.lol

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ChooserConfiguration
    The ChooserConfiguration interface describes the key characteristics of the level chooser screens.
    LolConfiguration
    The LOLConfiguration interface describes some configuration details of the game
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Animation
    Animation is a way of describing a set of images that can be used to animate an entity.
    Background
    The Background class provides a way to declare images that go in the background of the game, and which automatically pan and repeat
    Chooser
    The Chooser is a screen that gives the player a choice of levels of the game to play.
    Controls
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud).
    Controls.Control
    This is for handling everything that gets drawn on the HUD, whether it is pressable or not
    Destination
    Destinations are entities that the hero should try to reach.
    Enemy
    Enemies are things to be avoided or defeated by the hero.
    Facts
    The Fact interface provides a way for the programmer to store per-level, per-session, and per-game (persistent) information about the game.
    Goodie
    Goodies are physical entities in a game whose main purpose is for the hero to collect them.
    HelpLevel
    HelpLevel provides an interface for drawing to the help screens of a game
    Hero  
    Level
    A Level is a playable portion of the game.
    Lol
    A Lol object is the outermost container for all of the functionality of the game.
    Media
    The MediaFactory provides a mechanism for registering all of our images, sounds, and fonts Strictly speaking, we can re-create fonts on the fly whenever we need to.
    Obstacle
    Obstacles are usually walls, except they can move, and can be used to run all sorts of abritrary code that changes the game, or the behavior of the things that collide with them
    PauseScene
    PauseScene provides a way to suspend gameplay briefly and display information to the player.
    Physics
    Game designers can configure the physics of a level (i.e., the default forces, if any), via this class.
    PhysicsSprite
    PhysicsSprite is the base class upon which every game entity is built
    PostScene
    PostScene provides a way to display text and images after a level is won/lost, before gameplay resumes.
    PreScene
    PreScene provides a way to put a pop-up on the screen before a level begins.
    Projectile
    Projectiles are entities that can be thrown from the hero's location in order to remove enemies.
    ProjectilePool
    The ProjectilePool is the public interface to Projectiles.
    Route
    A Route specifies a set of points that an entity will move between at a fixed speed.
    Score
    Score is used by Level to track the progress through a level.
    Splash
    The splash screen is the first thing the user sees when playing the game.
    Svg
    The Svg infrastructure allows the game designer to load SVG line drawings into a game.
    Tilt
    Tilt provides a mechanism for moving entities on the screen.
    Util
    The Util class stores a few helper functions that we use inside of LOL, and a few simple wrappers that we give to the game developer
